Clause: A.L. Williams Corp. was merged into Primerica Corp., New York,
after a special meeting of Williams shareholders cleared the transaction,
Primerica, which had owned nearly 70% of Williams,
currently valued at almost $472 million, for the rest of Williams.
The financial-services company will pay 0.82 share for each Williams share.
Williams shares, which were to be delisted from the New York Stock Exchange after the close of composite trading yesterday,
Williams, Duluth, Ga., is an insurance and financial-services holding company.
Its subsidiaries' services are marketed by closely held A.L. Williams & Associates.
also acquired certain assets of the agency
and assumed certain of its liabilities.
